summary: This document is an email chain between US Attorney's Office (SDNY) contractors discussing the technical process of uploading, stamping, and producing digital evidence (approximately 40,000 files, 300GB) related to the US v. Epstein case into the Relativity review platform. The emails focus on logistics like Bates numbering, confidentiality stamps, and file formats for evidence seized during a search.

persons.name: Will
persons.role: Paralegal Specialist, U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY
persons.context: Appears as a sender in the email chain, providing instructions to mark documents as confidential starting at a specific Bates number and coordinating the evidence upload process.

events.title: Evidence Seizure Data Prepared for Upload
events.description: A hard drive containing approximately 40,000 files (300GB) of evidence, described as 'Images Seized During Search,' is prepared to be sent to a vendor for upload to the Relativity database for the US v. Epstein case.

events.title: Evidence Productions Made Available for Review
events.description: Two productions from the seized evidence (SDNY_PROD008 and SDNY_PROD009) are uploaded to Relativity and made available for review, containing about 22,000 of the original 41,000 files from the hard drive.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Approximately 40,000 files (300GB) of evidence, described as 'Images Seized During Search' in the FBI case file, were being processed for the US v. Epstein case in September-October 2020.
The evidence was being uploaded to the Relativity review platform under the case name 'US v. Epstein' for stamping with confidentiality markings and Bates numbers.
A discrepancy is noted: a hard drive contained about 41,000 files, but only about 22,000 appeared in the initial productions, prompting questions about whether some native files could not be imaged.
The email chain involves multiple redacted or partially redacted US Attorney's Office (SDNY) contractors, indicating a coordinated effort to handle sensitive discovery materials.
Instructions specify that all documents from this production should be marked 'Confidential' starting at Bates number SDNY_GM_00328864.
